intro: Stackhousia aspericocca f. genuina, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed stackhousia, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a leathery texture. This form is distinguished by its reduced pubescence compared to the typical variety.
